sentence 1: Bernard, who had not told the government official that he was less than 21 when he filed for a homestead claim, did not consider that he had done anything dishonest. Still, anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from him. [SEP] sentence 2: Anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from Bernard.
